title: Velocity vs time for dropped rock

content.question: A student drops a rock from the top of a cliff such that the rock falls downward toward Earth’s surface in the absence of air resistance. The downward direction is considered to be the positive direction. The graph shows the rock’s velocity as a function of time. Which of the following methods should be used to determine the total distance traveled by the rock after <math alttext="4 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: Use the maximum value of the curve, as it states that the rock traveled <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meters in <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> second, which means that the rock traveled <math alttext="160" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>160</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meters in total.
Use the area under the curve, as it states that the rock traveled <math alttext="80" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meters in total.

Use the slope of the curve, as it states that the rock traveled <math alttext="10 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> second, which means that the rock traveled <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meters in total.
The answer cannot be determined unless a graph of the object’s position as a function of time is given.

content.answer: Use the area under the curve, as it states that the rock traveled <math alttext="80" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meters in total.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
